pr_title: Fixed how the random teleporter picks a location.

timeline.message: Fixed how the random teleporter picks a location.

Amended my previous commit.
Before, I introduced a method to multiply a matrix by a vector, even though there were only ever 3 matrices that would ever be inputted. Instead, I took those three cases and simplified the math (it actually really simplifies) and hard coded it in. If there is ever a need for a method to multiply a matrix by a vector it wouldn't even belong in this class anyway.

Side note, the only thing that changed functionally in this commit is that the random point is no longer rounded to an integer, so the offset may be something like 5.83. I have no idea if that matters, but it can be changed very easily, and I'll allow whoever pulls this to make that decision.

timeline.author: pop4959

timeline.bodyText: The rest of this file doesn't really have javadocs, and none of it is really API. If you can match the code style and turn this into a simple line (or multi-line) comment explaining what it does that would be cool. Otherwise we might want to think about adding javadocs to everything else here. 😛

timeline.author: pop4959

timeline.message:
Add UserTeleportHomeEvent (#3403)

Adds an event which allows developers to see & cancel when users attempt to teleport home. This event is needed over `PreTeleportEvent` due to the fact that it would be extremely difficult to accurately filter it by the /home command.

Closes #3401

Made variable name plural

Co-authored-by: pop4959 <pop4959@gmail.com>

Made variable name plural

Co-authored-by: pop4959 <pop4959@gmail.com>
Functionally the same, style completely different.
